children.text: Hyperhidrosis (Excessive Sweating) Treatment in Pune - Stay Fresh & Confident with The Skin Firm
affecting underarms, palms, feet, and face under the expert care of

Hyperhidrosis is a medical condition where the body produces excessive sweat beyond what’s needed to regulate temperature. It can affect specific areas like the underarms, palms, soles, or face, or occur across the body.
can be uncomfortable, embarrassing, and disruptive - making handshakes, public speaking, or even wearing light-colored clothes stressful.
At The Skin Firm, we offer safe, advanced, and dermatologist-supervised
to reduce sweating, restore comfort, and boost confidence in daily life.
Excessive sweating even in cool weather
Constantly damp underarms, palms, feet, or face
Difficulty gripping objects due tsweaty palms
Embarrassment in social or professional settings
Skin irritation or fungal infections due tconstant moisture
Why Choose Hyperhidrosis Treatment at The Skin Firm?

Living with excessive sweating can feel frustrating and isolating - but you don’t have to struggle anymore. At The Skin Firm, we provide medical-grade, dermatologist-supervised treatments that address the root cause of hyperhidrosis.
- tailored to the severity and site of sweating
- combining treatment with lifestyle guidance for best results
We assess the severity, triggers, and areas affected by hyperhidrosis.
Based on your needs, we may recommend Botox injections, iontophoresis, medications, or lasers.
> Botox injections block the nerves that activate sweat glands.
> Iontophoresis uses mild electrical current to reduce palm/sole sweating.
> Laser therapy targets sweat glands for lasting results.
> We provide skincare advice and schedule follow-ups for consistent relief.

Adults with excessive sweating on underarms, palms, feet, or face
Teenagers with hereditary or early-onset hyperhidrosis
Professionals embarrassed by sweat marks during work

Anyone whose sweating disrupts daily life and comfort
FAQs on Hyperhidrosis Treatment in Pune
It’s a condition where sweat glands overproduce, causing excessive sweating beyond body temperature needs.
It cannot be fully “cured,” but treatments like Botox, iontophoresis, and lasers provide long-lasting relief.
Yes - it’s FDA-approved and highly effective for underarms, palms, feet, and face.

items.question: How long do Botox results last?

children.text: Typically 6-12 months, after which repeat sessions may be required.
Mild discomfort may occur with injections, but numbing creams make it comfortable.

items.question: How many sessions are needed for geting the hyperhidrosis treatment done?

children.text: Depends on the method - Botox usually requires one session; iontophoresis/lasers may need multiple.

items.question: Are there side effects after the hyperhidrosis treatment?

children.text: Minimal - temporary redness, swelling, or tenderness may occur, resolving in a few days.
No - antiperspirants may help mild cases, but medical treatments are required for effective relief.

items.question: Is hyperhidrosis treatment safe for all skin types?

children.text: Yes - treatments are safe and customised for all Indian skin types.

items.question: Can men also get hyperhidrosis treatment?

children.text: Absolutely - excessive sweating affects both men and women equally.
